projects.name: ForceTrack - Codeforces Analytics Dashboard
projects.description: An analytics dashboard that tracks Codeforces performance, contest history, and problem-solving activity of a set of codeforces handle.
responsibilities: Designed and developed a modern, responsive frontend using React.js, Tailwind CSS, and Recharts for visualizing contest history, problem stats, and student activity heatmaps.
Built a RESTful backend with Express.js and MongoDB to manage students, sync data from the Codeforces API, and serve analytics to the frontend.
Implemented cron jobs to automatically sync contest and submission data periodically, storing rating trends and problem-solving behavior over time.
Integrated CSV export, email reminders for inactivity using Resend, and a light/dark theme toggle to enhance user experience and engagement.

projects.name: Ranked - DSA Battles
projects.description: A competitive coding platform that matches users in real-time 1v1 DSA battles
responsibilities: Designed and implemented the backend, including APIs for matchmaking, code submission, judging, result processing, and rating updates.
Set up and integrated Judge0 (an open-source code execution engine) in an AWS EC2 instance to evaluate user-submitted code in real-time.
Integrated frontend with backend, ensuring smooth user flow from login to matchmaking to result display.
Utilized Redis for implementing a real-time matchmaking queue and leaderboard, using data structures like Sorted Sets for performance-critical ranking operations.

projects.name: Dhidvara - AI Terminal
projects.description: A warp like terminal that gives command suggestions and executes commands using AI.
responsibilities: Developed a terminal emulator using electron and React.js.
Integrated LLMs to provide real-time command suggestions while typing using Groq.
Implemented task automation via natural language prompts using @ commands.
Designed a custom terminal interface with support for AI ghost text and PTY handling.
